text: Jet black color with medium brown foam. Aromas of cocoa, light coffee, blackcurrant, and liquorice with light notes of salted caramel with sweet fruity notes. Palate, full body, smooth creamy texture leaving long lightly boozy creamy finish. Taste, bittersweet, of cocoa, with light boozy touch to it, with a slight nutty hint. Overall really good, although does remind of a stout, rather dark and cocoa like also very rich and smooth. Do recommend!

Mooi donker bier met dikke romige mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Licht noterig aroma. Diepe volle smaak. Lange subtiel bittere afdronk, licht warmend. Chocolade, hazelnoot, toffee, verschillende lagen. Complex bier waar je even voor mag gaan zitten. Werkelijk subliem.

Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, liquorice, boozy fruitcake and hazelnut. Delious smelling. Moderate sweet with low bitterness. Really satisfying beer with thick oily mouthfeel. Gorgeous.

Aromat: mocny i słodki, czekolada, praliny, likier czekoladowy, kakao, melasa, suszone owoce: śliwki, jabłka, gruszki.
Wygląd: ciemnobrązowe jak porter, nieprzejrzyste, gruby kożuch jasnobeżowej, średniopęcherzykowej piany, utrzymuje się długo.
Smak: bardzo bogaty i złożony, jest w nim cała masa różnych elementów. W smaku zdecydowanie słodkie, jest tu czekolada mleczna i gorzka, kakao, praliny. Bardzo wyraźny ciemny miód i suszone owoce- śliwki i gruszki, karmel, marcepan, nie ma tu palności tylko taka orzechowa gorycz. Jest tu dużo ciała, ale jest lżejsze od Risa, a przez to bardziej pijalne. Po chwili pojawiają się wiśnie w czekoladzie. Bardzo wykwintne, gładkie i aksamitne, świetnie ułożone, alkoholu jest dużo ale w ogóle go nie czuć. Na finiszu likierowość i lekkie ściąganie na języku, jakby od dębowej beczki. Balans perfekcyjny. Bardzo wyjątkowe i wyśmienite piwo.

Bardzo subtelny mocarz. Cudowne nuty miodu spadziowego, czekolada, dojrzałe ciemne owoce, trochę kawy i alkoholu. W żaden sposób nieprzegięte, dla wielu może być, za mało intensywne, jednak dzięki wspomnianej wcześniej subtelności, możemy cieszyć się kompleksowością aromatu i smaku.

Aromat jest stonowany, ale szlachetny. Dominuje lekka nuta ziemista, do tego lekkie cappuccino, coś ala miód gryczany, orzechy włoskie, ziołowość chmielu i leciutka torfowa wędzoność. W smaku przede wszystkim bardzo gładkie, aksamitne, lekko kawowo-miodowe, ale pojawia się tutaj sporo nut ciemnych słodów (absolutnie bez żadnej paloności), karmelowych (bez słodyczy), leciutka torfowa wędzonka i świetna podbijająca pijalność goryczka, lekka, ale charakterna o zdecydowanie europejskim charakterze. A propos pijalności - to dziwadło ma 10% alkoholu, którego w ogóle nie czuć. W ogóle. A łyka chce się brać co chwilkę. Wciągające, nietuzinkowe, nie afiszujące się fajerwerkami, za to bardzo hmm... szlachetne piwo. Będę musiał natychmiast uzupełnić zapas w piwniczce.

2012 bottle, cellar temp. Pours looking like bourbon county, black with really deep brown head. Smells like Surly 3. Sweet, dried cherry, honey. Flavor has a lot of roasty malt,hints of chocolate, hints of stone fruit. Body is medium heavy. 
What a strange, enjoyable beer.

Alright, I am finally getting around to rating this one. I have to admit that I utterly love this beer, and I have ever since I had my first sip of it about 2 years ago. 
Pouring it in the glass it already looks great. Very similar to an imperial stout in appearance - completely black with a small mocha-coloured head. The aroma is farther removed from an impy though. While it has the same kind of complexity and intensity of the former, the Bracia is not as roasty and boasts a unique aroma due to the addition of chestnut honey. This makes it sweet but adds a twist normal honey wouldnt. The chestnut honey aroma also blends perfectly with the malt base, which is dark and chocolatey and I even smell the peat (but that may be cause I know its in there). 
Mouthfeel is rather thick and oily and rich. Flavours are intense and complex with many layers, just like the aroma. Not as sweet as the latter the chestnut honey still shines through. Other flavours include coffee and licorice, a bit of a woody and a peaty note and also chocolate notes from the dark malts. Finishes long and caramelly/toasty with a bittersweet twist. The chestnut honey flavour remains. 
What an amazing beer.

Bottle at the Oxford University Club. Darker brown than black with a huge tan head. Salted caramel and hazelnut pervade the luscious aroma. Bittersweet taste with an intense meaty saltiness. Marmite and soy play with bittersweet chocolate in the aftertaste. Exciting and original.

Butelka. Aromat urzekający i potężny. Miód z dobrej pasieki, śliwki, takie wędzone. Duża słodycz, ciemne słody a wraz z nimi czekolada, toffi.

Nos zapowiada, a usta mają ucztę. Powtórzenie wszystkiego co znajdujemy w zapachu. Dodatkowym atutem jest idealne wysycenie i balans piwa oraz jego aksamitność. Czekolada, orzechy włoskie, lukrecja, miód i wędzona śliwka. Piwo wykwintne, wytrawne.

Bottle at home. 2013 or 2014 vintage. Had it new also but this is definitely a beer to age!
Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, nuts, dark rye bread, brown sugar, violet, plum and dried fruits. Finishes with a medium dry and bitter ending. Remembering the new one as too much violet and sugar. Perhaps.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Very Dark Brown and opaque in colour. Very Malty; strong dark coffee, chocolate, liquorice, honey, nuts, roast malts, caramel, hint of smoke. Apparently infused with dark and bitter chestnut honey. Hoppy; earthy bitter hops. Spicy, smooth, rich and velvety. Warming alcohol very evident. Sweet coffee roast malty throughout with a bitter slightly sour hoppy edge. Dry finish. Unique, interesting and complex. Terrific beer! (2009-06)

Bottle from Alko Sello, Espoo. Pours dark brown with a little brownish head. Strong roasty maltiness bursts immediately forward with a rich set of aromas; licorice, rye bread, dark chocolate and nuts combine with a subtle note of vanilla. Taste is brilliantly rich and varied; initial sweetish maltiness is paired with roasty notes and moderate bitterness in the finish. Flavours of chocolate, cocoa, licorice, rye pudding, hazelnut. The palate is medium to full bodied, smooth and low in carbonation. Simply excellent.

Bottle from Malting Pot. Near black, medium brown head. Aroma rasins, peper, mix of other spices, chestnuts. Taste goes from sweet, to bitter-sweet to medicinal bitter, coffee flavour present throughout. Quite complex overall, very nice ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Bottle Shop- Druid St. Dark and smoky, near black with bubbly brown head. Aroma is campfire, taste is more stout-y, some chocolate. Warmth sneaks up and makes you glow. Once acclimated, this one rocks.

From 500ml bottle. Pours dark, almost black with thin tan head. Rich, fruity aroma. Taste of raisins, prunes, a slight bitterness of coffee. One to be dipped and savoured

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 0.50l. Pours pitch black color with thick but quickly diminishing creamy brown head. Aroma of chocolate, capuccino, caramel, honey and nuts. Taste starts with moderate sweet and rich roasted malt, follows by licorice, coffee and chocolate, mouthfeel is warming, while finish is moderate bitter. Full body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Awesome, although honey not tasted as much as felt in the aroma...

Bottle conditioned. Loose tan head with no retention. Deep mahogany body. Nose is rich oak, mahogany, alcohol, vanilla, sherry, mace, nutmeg, roasted malt and a hint of smoke. Bubblegum. Gentle bitterness with some salt and umami. Soft mouthfeel. Full bodied.
Bottle shared, full body with a lot of sweet stuff. sorachis strawberry bubble gum flavour combine perfectly in this ale.

Bottle at home. Pours beautiful dark brown with a nice copper colored head. Aroma is roasted coffee, cocoa, bourbon oak, caramel and dried fruits. Taste has coffee, oak, roasty malts, caramel/honey and bourbon. Medium/long finish. Medium carbonation. I wouldnt change anything in this. Just amazing.

Bottle from Cornelius. Black body with a medium beige head. Faint lacing. Aroma of prunes, cherry and leather. Flavour of tobacco, black pepper, treacle and nuts. Medium to full body with a smooth, silky texture. Soft fizz. The alcohol is well hidden. A warming, complex beer.

500ml bottle. Black with a large dark tan head. Aroma: complex, roasted malts, coffee, dark ripe fruits, chocolate, honey, nutty. Taste: like the aroma is rich and complex, so many flavours... roasted malts and dark ripe fruits, coffee, liquorice, sweetness from the honey, spice, bitterness is there though, and finishing with warming alcohol but considering the 10% ABV its not that strong. Smooth creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, full body. What a treat this was, amazing flavours.
Great beer with so many flavours you can hardly imagine. Strong beer but you cant taste alcohol at all. The beer that thrones your tasting.

Data ważności:  30.03.2018 
 Kolor:  Czarny, nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Patrząc z góry wygląda jak potężna czapa pianki na wzorowo zaparzonym cappuccino.
Budują ją średnie i duże oczka. Ma ona ładny beżowy kolor i powolutku osuwa się w dół po krawędziach TeKu. 
Po dolaniu kolejnej porcji ponownie podnosi się do góry.
Po każdym łyku pozostaje krążek na szkle. Wzorowo! 
 Zapach:  Miazga, dosłownie miazga. Aromat jest tak słodki i tak przyjemny, że aż trudno odkleić nos od butelki.
Bardzo dużo tutaj się dzieje. Tak wyraźnej lukrecji dawno już nie czułem. 
Co niemiara tutaj kasztanów, miodu, śliwek, przypalonego karmelu i słodkiej czekolady z nadzieniem.
Daleko w tle orzechy laskowe, ciasteczka pieguski i szczypta rumu.
Cudowna uczta dla mojego nosa.
Zapach jest przepotężny wielowarstwowy.
Wow! 
 Smak:  Jeśli w zapachu była miazga to co ja mogę powiedzieć o smaku? Jest niesamowity!
Wielowarstwowy, wieloskładnikowy i wydaje się taki ułożony.
Początek to nuty miodu i kasztanów, następnie gorzka czekolada i wysokiej jakości kawa z mlekiem.
Na końcu języka orzechowa eksplozja i szczypta paloności.
Karmel i silna lukrecja kontrują ściągający, gorzki smak orzechów.
Piwo początkowo słodkie umacnia wraz z upływem czasu swoją wytrawną pozycję.
Tekstura jest zwarta i oleista. Odczucie w ustach półpełne, gładkie.
Szlachetny, degustacyjny, dostojny trunek. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie: 

Bracia to tradycyjne celtyckie, mocne Dark Ale wywodzące się z Epoki Żelaza.
Niewiele wiadomo o pierwotnej recepturze tego trunku. Pewne jest jednak, że było mocno alkoholowe, warzone z dodatkiem płatków zbożowych, miodu oraz kasztanów.

Fantastyczne piwo. Wiele ma wspólnego z RIS-em, ale także wieloma cechami się od niego różni.
Od samego początku fascynuje swoją dostojnością.
Sama etykieta wydaje się już bardzo królewska, szlachetna, której być może bliżej do wina, niż do piwa, ale za to już na starcie podkreśla klasę trunku.
Samo piwo jest niesamowicie zbalansowwane, wielowymiarowe.
Takie piwo, które zapamiętujesz na długi czas.
Nie sposób wymienić wszystkie jego składowe. Skupię się na zaledwie kilku, tych nietypowych.
Ogromna porcja miodu, kasztanów i cała masa lukrecji.
Od fenomenalnej piany, przez nieziemski aromat, a na jedwabistej fakturze skończywszy.
Bogaty smakowo, arcyprzyjemny w odbiorze i niezwykle wytworny trunek.
Bottle at home, 24th September 16. Pours rich and black, aroma is sweet, cararmel, spice, liquorice. Taste is spice, liquorice, dark fruit, Christmas pudding, saltanas. Good stuff

500mL bottle from Slowbeer. BB 13.03.20
Pours a big sparce sort of tan head atop a near-black body
Aroma is somewhat savoury - honey, sultana, raisin, toasted nuts, licorice, citrus & grassy hop.
Full bodied without being a bit as expected, quite savoury & dry overall, moderate carbonation.
Body is semi-sweet - honey & nuts, white raisins/sultanas, mild roastiness, hops seems less noticable with a touch of grass & floral undertone but the bitterness is there. Touch of warmth on the finish is the only really detection of this beers strength.
An intriguing English strong ale - plenty of character (lifts with warmth) yet nothing overly prominent

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 Very dark brown, small long lasting coffee head. Smells dark fruit, alcohol. Full body. complex taste. Will have to re-rate

Rerate on jan 2017

Dark brown, small coffee head. Very rich and complex aroma: buckwheat honey, wine, smoke, some tart candy (or fruit), nuts. Full body, velvety and mouthcoating, mild bitterness, some roasted notes, perfect balance. Moderate bitter finish

intensive and well outlined aroma - burnt/well fried malt, rotting oak wood, well dried ground coffee, aged wine in brandy cask, flowers, dark honey, dark chocolate with milk.
intensive, heavy, burnt, bitter, sourly and pungent taste - burnt and smoked malt, a bit roasted coffee, burnt wood, green herbs, sweetened cognac, concentrated coffee with milk, medium bitterness.
very good!

- völlig undurchsichtige schwarze Farbe mit guter, schnell zerfallender 
 Schaumbildung
- starke Aromen nach Bitterschokolade, Trockenfrüchten, Honig, Maronen,
 Lakritz, Kaffee, Nüssen und Rauch
- perfekte Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk ist einfach überwältigend
- die geschmacklichen Nuancen sind gut und eindeutig erkennbar
- der Honig verbindet sich mit der torfigen Malzbitternis in unvergleichbarer
 Art und Weise
- die ganz leichte Carbonisierung bringt ein schön ölig-samtiges Mundgefühl
 hervor
- der Abgang verstärkt die rauchige Bitternis nochmals etwas, ohne dass es
 im geringsten unangenehm wird
Fazit: Das perfekte Imperial Stout
Bottled 50cl. Colour : dark ale with thick brown head. Nose : coffee, chocolate. Aromas : roasted malts, resin, coffee, honey, bourbon whiskey. Low carbonation, dry texture, strong bitterness.

Pours black with thick and compact brown head. Nose is cream and chocolate. Aromas are roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, licorice, with a spicy note. Low carbonation, full body. Long spicy and roasty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Look: black, opaque, strong dark head.

Aroma is very rich and complex: cellar earthy notes, buckwheat, roasted nuts, bitter chocolate.
Taste: moderate sweet with complex bitterness (spicy, hoppy, alcoholyc).
Flavour: moulded cheese, mature cheese, dark honey, molasses, buckweat, ash, woody vanilla notes, light smoked notes, tar.
Bitter warming finish.

Very good and complex and unusual.

Black body with a tan head. Malty and strong aroma of dark caramel, chocolate, herbs, dark and complex honey notes (very far from light heather honey!), and dark dried fruits in the back. Strong flavour of dark caramel, bitter chocolate, dark honey and dark roasted malt, with a peaty whisky-like alcoholic background. Moderate sweet initial taste with a moderate bitter and long-lasting finish. Full-bodied and oliy with a soft carbonation. Great! And dark! 
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 6 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

Hyvin tummanruskea/musta olut todella runsaalla, mokkaisella ja paksua pitsiä jättävällä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa suolaista salmiakkisuutta, maltaisuutta, tammisuutta ja hunajaa. Hieman portviinimainen ote. Maku paahteinen, salmiakkinen, suupielet makeaksi saava, loppupuoleltaan kahvinen ja katkerampi. Täyteläinen suutuntuma, alkoholi ei tunnu lainkaan. Yllättävän pehmeää ja helppoa juotavaa, vaikka hitaasti nautiskeltava olut onkin.
Bottle, 500 ml, courtesy of Miro B. Shared with him and JFK 10000. Pours black with tan head. Roasted malts, bit nutty, liquorice, chocolate. Warming, sweet, dry, complex. Very nice.
Dark brown color. Oranges, cacao, nuts and roasted aromas. Roasted flavors with chocolate, nuts, dried fruits, spice. Very complex. Really good.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 Bottle in wine glass. I was surprised by how dark this is. Like a porter. The aroma is slight with licorice and hops coming through quite strong on the palate. The high ABV burns nicely with the heavy bitterness refreshing yet dark malt base. Great beer, that?s for sure.

Piana beżowa, sycząca, grubo oczkowa, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa ciemno brązowo rubinowa, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat nietuzinkowy i nieczęsto spotykany - głównie czuć tu miód, ale ciemny miód gryczany najwyższej jakości, melasę, świeże figi, rodzynki, bardzo wyraźny wosk pszczeli... W smaku fajna słodycz suszonych owoców przechodzi w całkiem sporą goryczkę migdałowo orzechową, przyjemną, następnie pojawia się palony karmel, toffi, wiśnie, marcepan w mlecznej czekoladzie, a całość spina likier kawowy. Gdzieś w afterteasie są też nuty winne, porto, sherry... Wysycenie średnie do niskiego, drobne, przyjemnie kremowa, gładka konsystencja.
Niezwykle rozbudowane i skomplikowane piwo, które jednak pije się bardzo przyjemnie. Bogactwo smaków i aromatów jest zadziwiające, przy tym trunek wydaje się jednak bardzo ułożony i przyjemny. Dla mnie mogłoby być nieco nagazowane.

Pours deep mahogany tinged brown into a snifter. Mocha head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Licorice and soy aromas. Thick with dark caramel, licorice and soy upfront turning to rich mocha in the warm, lasting finish.

deep dark brown colour with some ruby notes, medium sized creamy beige head; aroma of chocolate, dried berries, raisins, some honey, red wine, roasted sugar, herbal notes and hints of smoke; taste of dark chocolate, berries, raisins, herbal liqueur notes and hints of orange peel oils and grapefruit; really good beer!
Real nice, I probably payed a bit too much for it, but oh well. Alcohol was well masked and the honey distinguished it a bit but wasnt too obvious. Reminds me of Old Rasputin.

0.5l bottle. Black body, thick light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, orange zest, caramel, coffee, smoke and reisins. Taste of chocolate, smoke, orange zest and floral hops. Full bodied with a creamy texture. Very nice.
UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 Arômes très léger pour une stout, robe noire foncée, faible mousse beige. En bouche, très liquoreux, goûts bien balancé, amertume légère et torréfaction légère.

Wow, this is a new, great beer I hadnt had before. Being a ticker pays off sometimes, when other clowns are all up in Safeway grabbing their 200th six pack of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. 500ml bottle pours black in color with a one finger brown head that leaves thick lacing on the glass. The aroma is so big & rich that you expect to hear "Save a Horse, Ride a Cowboy" coming from it. Nutty and chocolatey with espresso, vinous dark fruit notes, honey, anise, and smoke. The flavor starts with sweet molasses, syrup, and semisweet dark chocolate, goes through overripe dark fruits, prunes and plums, and finishes with a peaty, smoky scotchy finish. Significant bitter hoppiness on the finish. Wow. The closest thing Ive ever had to this is Hair of the Dog Adam, which it goes without saying is amazeballs. Medium-plus bodied, not overly syrupy. Overall a really phenomenal, refined beer. Best English beer evs? Maybe.
Bottle, pours black with a dark tan head. Thick, smooth, creamy and complex. Dark chocolate, soft espresso, nuts, vanilla, dark fruit, fudge, bit of peat, wood, somewhat boozy. Great stuff.

Une grosse mousse beige capitonnée recouvre un liquide noir. Les arômes sont de grains grillés, de fruits foncés secs, de miel et dherbes fraîches. Ça sent bon. Les saveurs sont un mélange de tout ça, où la finale joue du côté de lacidité. Des pointes de torréfaction au-dessus dune présence imposante dalcool, qui lui, reste supportable. La touche sucrée est semblable à de lhydromel. Des noix? Rôties? Pas certain que ça soit ça (MA 13.03.20) (1769-100316)
50cl bottle. Dark bottle. Thin brown head. Medium light sweetness. Medium bitterness. Aroma is chocolate, pepper, chilli, bourbon, red wine, herby. This is very good!
Lovely stuff. Rich and boozy, great velvety mouthfeel. Slight honey sweetness, licorice, faint coffee and chocolate. Soft carb. Great old ale.

from Drinks of the World - black beer under a firm and long lasting dark beige foam; rich aroma of licorice, figs, earth and molasses; creamy palate, thick and full-bodied, bitter and fairly salty; long warming malty finish, herbaceous with more notes of licorice and molasses - strong, complex and beautiful

50cl shared bottle at home from Plan B,Rotterdam. Nose is red wine and roasted malt. Body is pitch black, head is medium, brownish, slightly fizzy, average lasting, good lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, dried fruits, honey, red wine, chocolate, licorice. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is long lasting roasty heavy bitter, wineish medium sour, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. A bit heavy, interesting, very unique, nice one.

Bottle. Black with a small head. Lovely full bodied complex flavour but surprisingly unstated considering its strength. Whilst some may see this as a criticism I just think it points to the skills that this brewery possess. Definitely one worth trying.
Bottle a black colored beer with a beige head aroma malts spicy oak caramel dark fruits and hops flavor malts citrus fruits spicy oak dark fruits coffee caramel spicy and bitter hops

Very dark Brown or even Black Color. Powerful aroma of dark fruits. Hints of plum. Coffee in the middle with hints of dark bread and raisins. Port wine in the finish. Not really heavy bodied, nicely balanced, interesting beer. However, would have expected something even more powerful.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2016 Bottle from Real Ale Store, Newark. Deep almost black colour with a thick tan head. Liquorice and deep fruity aroma roasted sweet taste.

Appearance: Very dark brown, seems clear. Ok amount of dark, tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, dark fruits, prunes.
Taste: Dark malt, slight coffee and chocolate. Burnt bitterness. Alcohol. A wee bit disappointed.
Bought: Drinks of the World (Bern), 500 ml, CHF 13.00
Info: 23/1-2016, BB: 24/10-2018

Nose is rich and complex. A bit of oxidization is detectable after a few years in bottle; this has not integrated favourably. Wet chestnut aroma is also present. Somewhat astringent flavour on the palate.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 butelka, warka do 13-03-20. Bardzo fajna piana, trwala, puszysta, samo piwo brazowo-rubinowo-czarne. Aromaty bardzo intensywne i bogate, duzo ciemnych owocow, swieze wisnie, banany i sliwki, suszone sliwki, rodzynki, kandyzowane figi. miod. do tego niemalo czekolady, toffi... w ustach analogia do aromatow, dosc pelne, slodkie, kwaskowate, jest goryczka, alkohol dobrze ukryty (glownie w posmakach wychodzi). pojawiaja sie tez nieco winno-drewniane i orzechowe posmaki w tle. duze wrazenie, mimo dosc rozbudowanych oczekiwan. bardzo kremowa faktura. bardzo zlozone, bardzo ladnie zrownowazone, bardzo klasowe piwo. generalnie: wow tzn łałOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).sprobowana nowsza warka i jest co prawda nadal super, ale... mniej super. Ocenka ciut w dol.

Couleur noire légère mousse. Nez chocolat, café, note boisée. Arome chocolat, malté tourbé, café et palais moka avec note de réglisse voir noisettes. Corps bien onctueux. Fin longue amere et grillée. Superbe

Bottle 50cl, a dark beer with medium brown head. Nose is on dark chocolate and coffee. Aroma is on dark coffee, dark chocolate, light smoked notes, licorice, toasted spices, toasted nuts, creamy body, excellent complexity, chocolate, brown caramel, light ashes, espresso notes, light plum, well malty very nice stuff.

Bottle. Red fruit, dried fruit, figs raisins, dark chocolate that gains on strength in the flavour, vinous and woody notes. Full-bodied, smooth and creamy beer with a dry, dark malty finish. Highly complex and balanced, superb stuff.

(Thornbridge Hall Bracia) Bottle 500 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 10%
Black coloured body, one finger of thick, dark brown head on top, with very good retention. 
Aroma of chestnuts, honey, vanilla, light coffee, dark fruits. 
Great taste, sweet but not cloying so, with lots of honey, light roasted malts, hints of alocohol, plums, dark fruits, chestnut, hazelnut, chestnut, coffee. 
Full body, soft carbonation, sticky on the palate. 
Very good.
Bottle. Dark pour. Aroma of smoke, roasted malt and herbs. Nice rich flavor of smoke, roasted caramelised malt, mild lirorice, honey and some hop bitters. Tasty and special beer.

50cl bottle shared for Christmas with family men. Pitch black with a full slowly diminishing tan head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Really well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Aromas & flavors of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, nuts and ripe fruits. Super delicious - still really expensive in our monopoly.

Refrigerated 0.5 brown bottle, says 9% abc, poured into a snifter. Black with small light brown head. Aroma is dark malt, thick body, light carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, honey, some nuts, and some anise.  Not sure why this is listed as a traditional ale this is an imperial stout.
Honey, flowers and chestnut in aroma. Pours dark brown with nice tan head. Taste is medium sweet with chestnut, caramel and some honey. Bitterness is low. Overall very interesting, unusual beer.
UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 Dark brown, nice lacing. Nice aroma: chestnut, honey, dark malts. Heavy body, medium sweetness. Very interesting taste. Chestnuts, some hoppiness, bit alcoholic. Unusual.
Dark and roasted malts, chocolate and a bit of sour peat. Full bodied with a great mouthfeel.
Takkatuli, hellameni. Hyväskä. Julmetun Hyvä. Voisi mennä räntäsateessa. Erinomaisen paksu.

Bottle - Vintage 2012 - Sweet, light herbal, touch of smoke, honey and grape. Jet black with a decent light brown head. Dark, bit of herbal smokey bitterness and nice sweet chocolate smoky finish. Very complex and nice.

Black with a brown head - Roasted malt aroma with some coffee notes - Dark malt body with some notesof coffee and chocolate - The dark malt with the notes of coffee and chocolate goes into the finish - This was good

50cl bottle shared at home. Pitch black with a full tan head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, nuts, ripe fruits, raisin and spices. Great full flavoured brew!

Very dark, thick head. Nuts, bread, coffee, liquorice, burnt. High bitterness, medium sweetness. Very strong and complex. Should be sampled slowly and in a focused state of mind to fully appreciate all the flavours.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2015 Delt med Ole Anders på Cardinal. Svart med høyt brunt tett skum. Kompleks og nydelig aroma med lær, lavendel, honning og herlig blomsternektar. I munnen er den myk og fyldig. Kanskje litt rå og salt i starten, men det er bare begynnelsen. Denne utvikler seg og slipper løs røstede toner, sødme, der kom honningen. Dette er kandidat til årets ølopplevelse for meg.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours a very deep ruby thats verging on black with a nice beige froth. The aroma is sweet with red fruit and honey. The taste starts with some spice before notes of honey, red fruit, liquorice, wood, leather and sherry. Lads of flavour going on and hugely complex. A beer unlike anything Ive had before. To begin with I thoughr there was a little too much honey flavour for my palate, but after a few mouthfulls the honey went to the background, replaced by coffee and chocolate making it feel much more like an imperial stout. Amazing.

500ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to Gary. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is raw honey, floral, light roasted malt, dark dried fruits, caramel and light roasted malt. Flavour is sweet. Medium to full bodied, oilyish texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet and lots of honey.

10%ABV. Srong Ale.

Poured out of the bottle a rich black-brown. 40ºSRM.

Nose has some very pleasant bourbon-like aromas. There is are pinot grapes in the nose. There are some nice honeyed date aromas. There is a nice sweet, wheaty slightly umami aroma, like yakitori (makes perfect sense really when you consider wheat, sugar and fire are common ingredients). Im going to take the grilled meat analogy one step further and suggest that the nose has that won There are very subtle oak and smoke flavors as well. Maybe its just my whiskey palate sneakig in here...


Mouthfeel is carbonated. Well balanced. The body on this thing is heftty and resplendent with full bodied deeply roasted sweet malts. The sweet embrace of the malts are relinquished to an almost startling bitter palate with hops, alcohol and a clean charcoal astringency. This is a beautifully calculated move to allow the palate to bloom and develop, producing nice hot coccoa, hand brewed coffee and more generic flavors of caramel, toffee and some tobacco.

Overall not a very shocking or interesting experience. 
The entire experience was predictable, but not in boring way, and more consistent with being comforting, reassuring and a feeling of being in your mothers warm embrace. A very solid rendition of a strong dark ale. Thoroughly well resourced which shows in the nose, the palate and the finish.

Completely enjoyable!

Goes on Favorites List!

Bottle. Black with a large creamy light brown head with good retention and lace. Rich and fat nose with chocolate, minerals, chalk, honey, dry flowers, green plants. Flavour follows the same lines; flowers, green plants, honey, fudge, chocolate, roasted malt, warming alcohol. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, sweet with bitterness and alcohol to balance. Rich and warming. Good.
Massive foamy brown head. Black. Strong and filling. Cigar, chocolate, liqourice, herbs. Sweet roasted malts. Full bodied, rich, balanced.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu snifteriin tummanruskeana/mustana, noin kolmen sormuisen ruskean vaahdon suojaamana, joka jättää vahvaa pitsiä. Tuoksu on hyvin monipuolinen: tammea, makeaa marjaisuutta, pähkinää, kuivattua hedelmää ja hunajaa on kaikkia hyvin vahvasti. Maussa pähkinä, tammisuus ja leipäinen maltaisuus on vahvinta, heti perässä tulee hunajainen makeus mukaan yhdessä kuivatun hedelmän ja marjaisuuden kanssa. Suutuntuma on hyvin paksu ja täyteläinen, alkoholikin kutittelee hieman mukana lämmittävällä vaikutuksellaan. Runsas ja monipuolinen old ale, todella hitaasti juotavaa tavaraa ja jokaista suullista pitää tarkastella hyvinkin tarkkaan. Ei välttämättä suosikkityylini, mutta tästä ei voi olla pitämättä...todellakin iso olut.

Smell of raisins, overripe fruit. Very dark brown colour, high dark brown head. Aroma of nuts, coffee, chocolate, also some tar and licorice. Sweet, also bitter. Very heavy body, slightly viscous texture. Great.
Pitch black color with beige head. Intense aroma of chocolate, coffee, caramel, licorice. Sweet burned and roasty taste with alcohol warmth. Amazing and well balanced beer!

Tap@ Kittys. Pours black with an espresso head. Roasted malty aroma, honey notes, burnt wood and raw licorice. Yummy. Flavor has roastedness, sweet dark fruity notes, again that honey like sweetness, nutty notes along with some wood as well. Complex brew. No sign of the high abv. Really good!

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2016 Tijdens bierproeverij, uitgeschonken in Struise BD degusteerglaasje. Diepe zwartbruine kleur, met kleine beige schuimkraag. Geweldig imposant aroma, met tonen van honing, bruine gebrande suiker, chocolade en nootachtige tonen, zoethout en wat turf. De smaak lijkt zeker wel op een Imperial Stout, en dan nog een hele goeie ook. Licht zoet, en aardachtige tonen van chocolade, honing en noten zelfs iets rokerigs van turf en tabak zit in het smaakpallet. Zachte carbonatie en een olieachtig mondgevoel, met een lange licht gebrande finish. Een zeer goed bier, zat helaas in een klein proefglas. Ga ik zeker nogmaals kopen voor een verdere beoordeling. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A clearish cola black body with a quickly settling dark brown head. Nose has intense aromas of chokolate, coffee and sherry-like oxidation. Taste is sweet and slowly advances to a lingering smooth bitterness. Low carbonation and rich, sticky palate. The alcohol is very well hidden. This is quite nice and well made, maybe a little one-dimensional, though?

Mmmh right. This is probably a beer with the most flavor I've ever tasted. Dark cola colored, almost black beer with an infinite beige head. Looks perfect. Aroma is full of different dark notes, coffee, salty licorice, leathery and vinous, smoked malts, dark bread, ripe fruits. Taste is dark malty, smooth and and leathery. Salty licorice, coffee. Very very smooth, full of flavor. Finishes with nice smooth bitterness. 100% in balance. Awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 500ml. Opaque dark brown, almost black, with a frothy brown head. Rich musky, complex aromas: dried fruits, caramel, dark chocolate, nuts, alcohol. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich and creamy. Exquisite roasted and dark fruit character with a fiery alcohol and bitter finish. A magnificent ale.

Bottle, 500ml. A pitch black beer with a medium size brown head. Aroma is of dark chocolate, caramel, nuts, coffee, a hint of honey and maybe cinnamon. Taste is bittersweet with a slightly alcoholic finish. Dense with some carbonation and astringency. Impresive character of chocolate and spices. Strong and long lasting aftertaste. A truly exceptional beer.
Pours black with medium-sized , beige head. Aroma of chocolate , honey , roasted malt , raisins. Same notes in rather sweet taste ;light , roasted bitterness in aftertaste. Awesome !!!!

Pours dark coffee brown with medium creamy light brown head. Good lacing. Malty aroma - nuts, chocolate, toast, pudding, alcohol. Medium hops with notes of grass and resin. Medium yeast aromas with notes of slight meat and basement. Notes of cocoa, tobacco and cappuccino. Medium sweet, bitter rather dry long finish. Body is medium, palate is velvety, carbonation is soft. Very good.

Pours an average light brown frothy head that mostly diminishes. Body is black.
Aroma contains moderate malts (dark bread, hay, roasted and burnt malts, molasses, chocolate, coffee, nuts), moderate hops (resin, herbs, citrus fruits), light yeasts (dough, barnyard) and grape, raisin, plum, honey and licorice.
Flavor is ligh acidic, then light acidic, sweet and light bitter, followed by sweet and bitter and finishing in bitter.
Body is full with syrupy texture and soft carbonation.
Great bear for a winter evening. Full bodied, subtle and enough complexity to make it better than average.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: toasted malts, caramel, alcohol. Appearance: black, medium, beige, creamy head. Taste: light bitter and sweet. Palate: bitters intensify, toasted malts intensify, caramel, toffee, turning quite dry in the finish, full body, soft carbonation. Overall: very nice Tradional Ale, full bodied, immensely complex. Bottle from Wittich Weine und Biere, Olten.

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2015, Drammen
Pours dark brown/black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, hint of coffee and hint of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long warm, malty, roasted and chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

tap @ Konttori

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2015 Black opaque colour with brown, creamy and fim head. Practically without visual carbonation. Aroma: Alcohol note is in second plan, namely notes of malts, especially of chocolate and coffee, dominate. But you can also detect hops: some notes of tropical fruits, herbs... You can detect chocolate, tobacco, honey, pine, molases... Body is full and adhesiv, bitterness is surprisingly high, hop bitterness in finish also. Complex beer. Very good beer, for surly the best brew made by Thornbridge.

Pours pitch black with tan, creamy head. Aroma of coffee, caramel and dark fruits. Taste is deep, some honey, chocolate with little bitterness in the finish.
Excellent one.
Black with a brownish head. Nose has coffee, burnt and nuts. Whiskey-like smoke and alcohol with lots of coal. A long burnt after taste.

Strong aroma of chocolate and coffee. Very dark in appearance with a brown foam. Sweet full body taste, with a strong presence of chocolate and coffee, a hint of liquorice nicely balanced with the bittersweet taste of the chestnut honey and nice lasting chocolate aftertaste. Great beer, perfect for dark ale/porter/stout fans.

Opaque dark brown pour. Smells like a slowly opening chalky milk stout, releasing damp muscovado and fruit sugars as it sits. Strangely spicy in taste, with an earthy tobacco leaf dryness underneath, a host of fruit caramels and muscovado sugars, contoured by a natural ("organic") wet pasture/manureish yeast profile and a bit of an abv burn. The missing link between Doppelbock, Belgian Dark Ale (Gulden Draak) and UK old ale? Hard to gauge, might revisit.

Sample at Tilquin Englisch Beer Festival 2015. Thanks for sharing!
APPEARANCE: black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: chocolate, coffee, malty.
TASTE: choclate, coffee, malty, bitter.

16.9oz bottle. Black in color with a good sized tan head. Aroma is of jasmine, raw honey, leather, raisin, bread, licorice, and roasted malts. Taste is of roasted malts, smoke, honey, licorice, toast, and molasses.

Bottle. The look is dark, brown to black in color, and has a tan head. The smell is honey, herbal, throat lozenge, sweet, floral, licorice, raisin, leather, and nice. The taste is malty, roast, leather, licorice, bitter, floral, plum, and jam.
Draft @ Tilquin English Beer Festival 2015. Very good honey notes predominate the aromas and in the taste which goes perfectly with this kind of dark complex brew. Delicious.
Draft at Tilquin English Beerfestival. Lots of caramel, bitter chocolate, high alcohol, nice!

Bottle 50cl. Pitch black with a caramel coloured head. Very intense aroma of subtle chocolate, roasted malt and tar. This is what I call a rich beer. Full bodied, dark chocolate, espresso and some dried fruit. Very nice. Long lasting finish. Perfectly in balance with a pleasant bitterness. An absolute superb beer.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 19B, adapted). Bottle 50 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: aroma of sweet coffee (cappuccino, coffe and milk), black liquorice, dark chocolate, slight roasted cereals and faint wallnuts. soft alcohol aroma on the background. APPEARANCE: very dark brown color and opaque. brown average head with average retention. alcohol derived viscosity with some lacing. TASTE: initial prominent coffee and dark chocolate with a supportive moderatly sweet background. notes of black liquorice and a faint wallnut note. apparent low hop derived bitterness altough the finish is bitter from the roasted malts. finishes semi-dry with a long coffee-like and nutty aftertaste. PALATE: velvety texture with a medium-full body. smooth alcohol warming. OVERALL: an outstanding and complex dark ale that should be enjoyed at a very slow pace. higly recommended.

Bottle at Van Moll, Eindhoven. Deep dark brown color, brown head. Great rich nose and taste with coffee and chocolate, dried fruits, honey, vanilla and bourbon. Incredible lingering aftertaste with sweet coffee and caramel tones. Low carbonation, big body and creamy mouthfeel.

Looks pretty stoutish..black with a small tan head, poured slowly. The lacing is pretty impressive.

The smell is big time, umm, roasty, nutty, chocolaty, smell some licorice, coffee..yummy.

As bold as the aromas permeating my nosebuds are, the taste takes it up a notch. Hazelnuts and coffee abound, licorice is there but plays a minor role. This is really quite bitter and right at the end, I get a bit of a smoky character.

Its not overly heavy in the body. More like what Ive seen mentioned...velvety smooth. Spot on carbonation.

This just plain blows me away with how good it is and how drinkable it is. At 9% abv, theres no alcohol in the taste at all. Just a wee bit of warming on a morning, here in Casper, where its BLOODY SNOWING and there was no warning. Cheers!

6.12.2013. Täysin musta, ruskea vaahto. Tuoksussa paahteista kahvia. Maussa ensin kermaista pehmeyttä, siirtyy paahteiseen ja leipäiseen, omenaa, keskellä suklaan ja kahvin aromeja, pähkinää. Jälkimaussa karamellia ja kuivaa paahteisuutta.

Choklad , russin, maltynees doft. Dark choklad, sweet bitternes in the palate. Mörk malt smak, bitter Coffe.

Huge brown head. Color is deep black. Coffee, hazelnut, caramel aromas. Flavor is the same. Some bitterness. Texture is oily. Carbonation is soft to average. Average to long coffee finish. Well balanced

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 3 varieties at Craigs. Bbe 2009, 2015 and 2017. Rich, fruity, and sweet, nice smooth honey from the latter two.
Bottle at home, bbe 25/11/16.  Pours deep brown, nose is smoky, toffee, caramel, raisins, honey, taste is dry, smoky, salty, toffee.  Little oxidised but tasting nice.

Pite rok temu. Butelka 0,5.
Kolor/faktura - w szkle, czarny jak smola. przy brzegach pod swiatlo mozna zobaczyc wisniowo-brazowe refleksy. faktura gesta, oleista, przypomina dobrego RISa. wysycenie lekkie do sredniego, idealne dla tego piwa. 
Piana - swietna, brazowa, bardzo drobna. utrzymuje sie dlugo. oblepia scianki szkla. 
Zapach - ciemne i suszone owoce, karmelowa slodycz, palonosc.
Smak - gorzka kawa i czekolada, kwiatowosc, nuty owocowe, palone slody, spora slodycz od miodu ale i alkoholu ktory lekko grzeje w gardle podnoszac tylko pelnie piwa. Na finiszu lekka goryczka chmielowa, ale nie zalegajaca. 

Piwo jest naprawde rozbudowane, spokojnie mozna go traktowac jak dobrego RISa.
75cl bottle @ the 11th Shrewsbury Bottle Share, Feb 15. Pours deep dark with a plummy aroma. Oily mouthfeel with chestnut honey and ripe plums in the taste.. a touch rubbery. Very nice.

Shared on 17 Feb 15 in Shrewsbury. Almost black colour with a tanned topping, 100ml each. Roasted malts in the nose with dark fruits, semi-sweet dark chocolate and wood esters. The taste followed along the same lines, woody and earthy in equal amounts with an alcohol kick from the first sip. Good body depth and far too easy to drink.

The beer is dark, almost black with generous brown head. Aroma is rich with notes of dark and dried fruits. Lots of toffee, chocolate and burned carmel. Lots of honey in taste. The sweetness is strong and syrupy. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy. The beer makes me think about a Stout with strong honey flavors. Still different and of the kind. Delicious but difficult to drink.

Huge beer! Moderate roasted intense maltiness, coffee and choco presence makes me to think I am drinking decent imperial porter like stout. Bit licorice, nuts, dark fruits, right amount of hops for balance, 
quite herbal bit citrusy, mostly lemon. Moderate sweet with bittersweet finish. Highly enjoyable indeed. Thou nothing extraordinary.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a brown head.
Aroma: Liquorice, malt, fruit, vinous, raisin.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, liquorice, fruit, raisin.

Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, hazelnuts, dark chocolate, dark fruit, & some espresso; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel/honey, dark chocolate, espresso, and dark fruit; Warm finish; Nicely balanced & complex; Wow - surprised by this one - delicious!

Bottle. Opaque black brown beer with a large brown head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, molasses, licorice, vanilla, chocolate, wood and herbs. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, toffee, chocolate, molasses, licorice and coffee, honey and nuts. Wow, outstanding flavor!

Very complex aroma; coffee, chocolate, bread, honey, berries, booze, yeast. Taste is also quite interesting. Some dried fruit, biscuit, coffee, caramel,.. a bittersweet sensation that ends quite dry. Excellent beer, real craftsmanship
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Svart oljeaktig, lotw karbonert. honning, noe røyk. Preg av eik og rødvin. Meget god

Bottle. Beeches of Walkley, Sheffield. Clear, dark chestnut brown. Bubbly, tan head settles to a persistent, sticky halo. Earthy, woody, massive dark chocolate. Treacle. Booze. Lots of the chestnut honey. Very rich. Lesser notes of nuts, and floral, slightly green hops. Taste is richly sweet, turning earthy, burnt bread crust bitter. Heady, warming, chewy, smooth palate. Very full, and slightly oily. Finishes long, roasty, earthy bitter. Lovely. Suits cask dispense better, but that doesnt come round too often.
Pours a pitch black beer with a good tan head. Smells malts, honey, rye and caramel. Tastes malts, rye and honey. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede mooie bruine kleur. Ruikt vanille, crème, beetje koffie ,tikkeltje alcohol. Smaakt bitterzoet, vol, vanille, crème. Beetje koffie en iets bitter.

Bottle - deep black with a very dark brown, large foamy head which stays around for a good while and gives some good lacing. Aroma of cocoa, roast malt, a little grass, some plum and a light sourness. Taste of cocoa, chocolate, roast malt, treacle and earth. Medium bitterness on the finish. Some hints of orange and vanilla. Thick body, medium carbonation. Very rich.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Pours dark brown, cream tan head dies quickly to ring and patches. Nose of honey, roast nuts, slight smoke, chocolate. Tastes sweet dark honey, vanilla, roast, ash, quite heavy bitter, cacao, nuts, some earthy bitterness too. Rich, full body, creamy slick feel, moderate carb, long nutty bittersweet honey finish. This beer is remarkable. Very complex, far more than my words above can do justice to, and unique, even among braggot-style ales.

Appearance is very dark, almost black, brown tinged at the base. A foamy, fluffy, tan coloured head which settles down. Aroma- complex. Blackcurrant, raisin, nutty, vinous, port notes, cocoa hints, malty. Taste- also very complex. Chocolate, nutty, almonds, marzipan, dark cherry, an understated honey sweetness, vanilla hints, bitter, lingering finish, some booze but well hidden. Really excellent.

500 ml bottle from systembolaget bs. Pours black with nice brown head. Sour roasted aroma with sweet coffee taste. Great beer with very nice balance. Loads of coffee and cocoa. Nice chocolaty aftertaste.
Draft. Black with a tan head. Lots of smoke, coffee, chocolate, honey, earthy notes and a touch of vanilla at times. Very complex but a little abrasive at times.
Fruity aroma, with hints of strong coffee and chocolates. Complex taste of nuts, coffee, nougat, orange fruit, and white cheese.
Dark chocolat espresso... fark sugR abd oak.a..awesome aroma...taste is cakelike s weet with lots of off flavoours lik we caramel and coffey.. great...

Black with a brown fat looking head. nose: coffee, nuts, liqueur, alcohol, dark fruits, fat coffee milk, the alcohol gives a sharp sense. overall complex. taste: roasted malts, coffee, moccha, alcohol, dark fruits. MF/ creamy body, smooth, carbonation. some bitterness, alcohol gives a lot of punch, but is also warming. Ok, but a bit overdone (for me). lacks some balance (for me)

Bottle from Bottle Shop, Cheadle Hulme [281114]
Pitch black, thin tan head, some lacing
Aroma of rich dark malts, no roast, rich dark caramel, dark fruits, dark honey, slight soy, dab of toffee, complex
Taste of rich sweet dark malts, dark fruity nutty honey which has an unusual taste, rich dark fruits, some sweet dark chocolate, dab of molasses, hint of treacle, some alcohol soaked fruits, very complex
Palate - Soft carb, full body, sweet rich texture. Finish of rich dark syrup malts, dark fruits, that unusual dark nutty honey, soft warming alcohol
Overall - Complex, its the honey that makes the taste of the beer a bit mysterious and works very well. Very nice. I prefer the PX version which is just spectacular.
Wonderfully bittersweet with notes of honey, licorice, chocolate and caramel and a lightly smoky finish. Outstanding with dessert -- in our case homemade cheesecake. Yum

Dark brown/black with a good beige head. Aroma is red grapes, raisins, figs, caramel, fig, grape seeds. Medium-full bodied, rich and complex on the palate, hint of booze on the finish. Taste is purple grapes, chocolate, raisins, honey, chestnut.
Very dark brown color, big brown head. Aroma of coffee, dark fruits, wood, caramel, dark chocolate. Full body, soft carbonation. Medium sweet taste, light bitter finish. Full and complex.

Pitch black color with beige head. Roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, honey, nuts. Taste is even better than expected from the aroma. Finish is bitter coffee and a bit of smoke. Fantastic complex brew.
Incredibly dark color. oily vanilla sweet taste. Intense flavor. Insanely good beer. Nothing more to say.

A remarkable beer, a masterpiece honestly, complex in a way that little else can hope to be. From the sweet, light cocoa in the front, paired with some honey and nutty character, to the finish of light peat smoke and a bit of a meaty character, this beer is a lot of different things but never too hard to "get." Just spectacular.

bottle at a bar shared with a friend. poured a dark black colour with a tan head. man i wasnt expecting this! chocolate, sweet caramel, roasted malts, dark red fruit! dark espresso beans, liqorice, nuts, honey, more fruit covered in chocolate, very full thick mouthfeel!! very good!!

500ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks). Pitch black color. Massive brown head, stays. Malty, roast, caramel and some nutty notes in aroma. Roast, sweet, spicy hops, black pepper in taste. Creamy coffee in aftertaste.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 500ml bottle (Drink Shop, Tallinn) BB2018-10, drunk 2014-10
Well, I had the horrible barrel aged version of this, which was way too sweet, and like sun-tan lotion, so I decided to let this age for about a year before trying it, so that it had time to mellow. Sweet mashy aroma, a little raw and under-attentuated. Lovely dark brown, persistent tight tan head. Was just a joy to pour and look at afterwards, the viscosity and tighness of the bubbles was beautiful. Full smooth palate, sweetish. Tons of toasted coconut, pleasant sweet caramelly malts. Covers the alcohol better than it covers the Sorachi Ace. Not quite the toasted coconut of a Maui Coconut Porter, alas, its still the sun-cream aspect I dont like. As it warms it stays mellow, but doesnt become too sweet or sticky. Do like the toastiness in the finish, and also a very nice dry bitterness. Alas it goes in waves, sometimes the sorachi ace is just horrific.

0,5 l bottle s
Appearance:Black liquid with a noice 2 fingers sized creamy tanned head. Good retention and Leaving some nice lacings.
Aroma: Complex big arroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, honey, chestnut, plums.with grass and alcohol in the background. . 
Taste: Very well balanced, Starts sweet with roasted malts and honey, followed by chestnut, dark chocolate, coffee, tones then some plum and raisin sweetness to balance it . Befor it finished with roasted malts and grassy hops. 
 heavy body. medium carbonation., smooth texture.

Great,powerfull and refined.
Tap at olutexpo. Black color, brown head. Aroma is nicely roasty, coffee, some sweet fruity notes. Taste is perfectly balanced, roasty, vanilla, chocolate. One of best stouts tasted.

Svart med ett tätt, stort brunt skum. Doft: Kaffe, rostade nötter, marknads marmelad godis, kola/grädd likör, trä, kakao, lätt sötat rågbröd. Smak: Kaffe, kakao, gräddlikör, karlssons fyrkant, lakrits, trä, lite sot, rostade nötter.

Bottle Share 03/10/14
Black and damn good. Tick tan head, Rich and fruity, hints of coffee and chocolate. Very very good.

500ml bottle served in an English pint glass.
A: Pours a creamy liquid with an oily black color. Forms a big, creamy and quite bubbled tan head. Good retention and lots of thin but quite molasses lacings in the glass
S: Very reach nose. Strong notes of roasted malts, honey, chestnut, chocolate, coffee and plums. Some citrus notes. Grassy hops and a bit booze
T: Perfect taste. Great bittersweet balance. Very complex. Sweet upfront with strong notes of roasted malts, honey, chestnut, dark chocolate, coffee, plums, raisins and orange peel. The end is quite bitter, a mix of roastiness and grassy hops
M: Creamy, molasses, smooth heavy body. Medium carbonation. Bittersweet aftertaste, followed by some citrus and grassy notes
O: Masterpiece
[ BA Review @ 5/25/2014 ]
Poured from a large format bottle. The aroma is sweet honey, alcohol, fruit, berries, slightly malty. The flavor is honey sweetness, nutty, chocolaty, warming alcohol. Very good beer.

pours very dark brown with a thin tan head and some spotty lacing. complex aroma with notes of nuts, licorice, peat, bread and beets. rich, fruit forward taste with wood notes,cherries, licorice and bitter herbs. finish is bitter and slightly tannic.

Un nez incroyable et difficilement descriptible tant il est complexe. On sent bien le côté tourbé et fumée avec une fin de guimauve et de miel très prononcé. Malgré les degrés elle possède une belle mousse beige foncée qui dure et colle au verre. En bouche cest très puissant est riches et il ny a aucun défaut. Lamertume balance extrêmement bien le corps ce qui rend cette bière très « drinkable ». Au final une bière dexception à déguster avec des gens que lon aime beaucoup ! Cheers !!

Bottle 0.5l at Belgrade Beer tasting vol.4 from ippopotamo36.Thank you Alberto for sharing Ajde.Pour it dark color with medium white head.Taste of tobacco, chocolate, roasted coffee.Sweet, dry and bitter on the end.Good balanced. Great.

Bottle at tasting in Belgrade. Huge thanks to ippopotamo36. Gorgeous thick black pour with nice brown head. Deep black crusty bread. Great yeasty bitter, dark bready, some leather. Bracing. Cocoa nibs, dry clean coffee. Good bitterness, dry finish. Lovely.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - murky brown with a nice head. 
Nose - honey and chocolate orange biscuits. 
Taste - bitter marmalade and hazelnuts. Then honey at the end.
Palate - medium to full bodied with a big tangy texture and a dry tangy finish. 
Overall - its not as dark and roasty as expected. Very complex and interesting though.

Dark brown body with a thick to medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, hops, fruits. Taste is medium to heavy sweet with medium to strong bitterness. Medium body, rich, creamy texture with bitter finish. Nice solid ale.

Bottle at SSAN V. Black pour with brown head. Aroma is roasty, spicy, woody, tons of tobacco, light smoke, nutty and fruity. Flavor is roasty, spicy, again lots of tobacco, light smoke, peat, very multi-layered, nice complexity. Palate is full bodied with good carb. Nice stuff.

Bottle at a private tasting in Belgrade/Serbia. It pours oily black, brown consistent head. Nose is leather, tobacco, Serbian kafana :-). The mouth is very good: dry and bitter aftertaste, roasted malts initial start and herbal feel.

From old notes, tasted with Curtis and some friends in Nashville, probably some time near the summer of 2012, from a bottle. Pours inky dark brown with a thin brown head that leaves a nice collar of lace. The nose is tons of dark chocolate, coffee, toasted cocoa nibs, generally very roasted. The flavor is has a touch more molasses and dark chocolate sweetness up front, moving to all of the roasted bitterness of coffee and nibs, nicely balanced. The body is full with average carbonation and a long bitter dark chocolate and coffee finish.

Black color, small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, wood, coffee, honey and herbs. Taste has roasted malt, licorice, dark chocolate, coffee, hops, dried fruits and hint of smoke - sweet with light dryness and nice roasty and hoppy bitterness in finish and complex aftertaste. Full body and smooth carbonation. Wonderful beer, very delicious.

(bottle) Opaque black coloured hue with a brown and firm foamy layer. Rich dark malty aroma with distinctive notes of oak honey, mildly roasted notes, liquorice, cacao and dark chocolate. Sweet and delicately roasty bitter flavour, full bodied with a very smooth, almost creamy carbonation. Robust dark and roasted malty taste with a cornucopia of flavours, such as caramel, liquorice, chocolate and espresso, also some ashy notes in the most positive sense; moderately sweet and roasty bitter finish with almost oily nutty notes and dark chocolate. Wonderful. 11.III. & 26.VIII.14

Bottle from systembolaget. Aroma has notes of malts and espresso coffee. Pours black with a medium brown head. Taste has roasted malts, chocolates and coffee. The taste is strong and tasteful. Palate is full and the taste sticks to the tongue. Overall a good beer, which is recommended not to serve cold.

500ml bottle courtesy of angst, Thanks. Pours a dark brown color with a small khaki head that slowly recedes to a fine film. The aroma is big and bold with leather, mocha, toffee, nuts and wet dog. The taste is a bit unusual with leather in the forefront, followed by coffee, mocha, dark fruits, anise, burnt toast and mixed nuts. The palate is full and creamy smooth with soft carbonation. Finishes long and dry. Overall: Very original brew--and very enjoyable, its not like anything Ive ever tasted.

Historical ale apparently referring to a style of ancient honey beer called bracia in Antiquity, so I had no idea what to expect here. Made with eight malt components and four hop varieties along with chestnut honey - an exciting promise. Thick and rocky, yellowish head, colour a very dark brownish bronze. Impressively perfumed aroma of lots of things: honey of course, pear, hazelnuts, chocolate, cappuccino, rosemary, aniseed, caramel, and so on, and so on - one of those luxurious ales I would rather whiff than drink. Taste of dark fruits, berries, very profound maltiness with caramel and some roasted chocolatey accent in the lead, sweetish honey, spices, very complex and ending in a toasted bitterness with deliciously warming alcohol without astringency, next to floral and herbal hoppiness. An absolute delight - though I can hardly imagine beer quality in Antiquity was this good...
Fuccin heel! Is this an amazing beet or what? An example of a beer that will fucc you and treat you good at the same time.

Pours a thin beige head that settles to the edge. The body is an opaque deep brown. Nose of leather, licorice candy, rubber and nutty chocolate. Starts mildly malted than quickly hits with a leathery tobacco mid-palate, boozy, deep semi-sweet bitter chocolate and prunes. Very lovely. Thank you Alex for this experience :)

Aroma: coffee, honey, dry orange, roasted nuts
Appearance: pitch-black, minimal head
Taste: medium bitterness, medium sweetness, slight sourness
Palate: bitter finish, thick texture, full body, soft carbonation

Absolutely terrific beer of dense, multi layered Taste, comprising some of the Best valesca of ales, stouts, bocks and porters.
Duft av kaffe og vanilje. Dyp sort farge. Brunt kremet skum som forsvinner. Fin smak av kaffe, lakris og vanilje.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown with a large small-bubble brown head, Aroma is chocolate, soy, licorice at first, as it warms up a spicy green pepper note with a light smokiness takes over. Taste is sweet chocolate and licorice, finish is coffee, soy, licorice and medium roasted bitterness. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Appearance: ruby bronw with creamy head.
Aroma: hops, roasted malt, licorice, dried fruit.

Bottle 0.5l at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Originally rated 21012012. Colour is dark brown with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, chocolate, red wine and malts.

Large tan head dark pour mild to medium carbonation aromas grain caramel toffee nuts earthiness the flavours medium strong bitter toffee chocolate liquorice roast coffee wheat cereal caramel citrus peel noted honey very rich but smooth ale rather nutty tasting hazelnut peanut like taste brilliant stuff the finish wonderful earthy tastes malts nuts honey grain the best of the best great drinking ale or sipping

Pours deep black. Lovely solid tan head. Leaves good lacing on glass. Big chocolate, coffee, alcohol, lactose, aniseed liquorice, nuts,. Flavour is a creamy milk latte, caramel, hazelnut, dry earth, liquorice, cherry. A slightly dry finish but it is so luscious its leaves a milk chocolate aftertaste. Slight alcohol hit. Its a beer you delve into and find it hard to leave. Layers of complexity. Great beer.

Dark brown, big brown head. Nose is malts, toasty notes, dried fruit, chocolate, apples, nutty notes. Flavor is apples, malts, chocolate, toasty and peaty notes, coffee.Dry toasty finish. Full mouthfeel with vinous notes. Very nice. Shared by martjoobolut, thanks!

BOTTLE 50CL

Look: pitch black , espresso frothy to creamy head.
Aroma: rich black malts, chocolaty, something totally hard to get sweet-vegetal-caramelized (is this the chestnut honey?), fresh-cut pumpkin, light alcohol, dark dried fruit.
Taste: intense, sweet and chocolaty, dried fruit, nutty, spicy alcohol byte and potent bitterness. Unique and intense. Excellent!

0,5L bottle, BB 24.10.18. Pours dark brown-black with brown head. The head stays. Aroma is dark chocolate, dark fruits, and malt. Taste is sweet and bitter, raisins, dark chocolate, and roast. Finish is dark chocolate bitter with some sweetness and alcohol. Overall: very nice brew.

24.03.2013, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Fyldig sødmerik lukt med preg av mørk malt, humle, salt lakris, mørk frukt, alkohol, kaffi, karamell, mørk sjokolade. Fyldig lett tørr og sødmerik smak med preg av mørk malt, humle, lakris, kaffi, bitter sjokolade, mørk frukt, brent karamell. Middels bitterhet som set godt. Veldig god.
Aroma is dark malts, earthy, chocolate, roasted notes and mildly spicy. The flavor is dark malts, honey, roasted/spicy notes and a mildly sour/bitter finish.
Black. Glassy tan head. Aroma and flavor of barley syrup, oak and alcohol. Very smooth on the palate with a foamy dry finish.

Bottle. Peat smoke, chestnut, and dark chocolate/coffee, and malt aroma. Dark brown with small head. Sweet burnt peat, dark chocolate, raisin, and barley malt flavor. Moderately bitter ash and herbal finish. Very delicious.

Bottle boosted @ the Royal Mile, just this evening! 
Pours black with a huge fluffy tan head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is rich, sweet & floral with nice honey tones. Its pleasantly but lightly roasty and has just a touch of smoke. 

The flavor is not as sweet as the aroma, its got a nice coffee like roastiness, a medium but well suited level of bitterness, some floral & rich honey notes are featured as well. The beer has some spicy alcohol & the peatiness of the beer intensifies as it warms. 

Really enjoyable stuff!

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 Pours black with low off white head
Aromas of dark fruits, tar, coffee, alcohol, dried fruits
Taste has coffee, chocolate, peat, bread, brown sugar, dark fruits

Bottle: Labeled as 9.0%
Purple-black with a thick, dark tan head.
Chocolate wine, cherry aroma.....molasses, wood, smoke.
Taste is equally complex....peat, vinous dark fruit, chocolate, ash, malt...
Sweet, with a slow, warming alcohol presence...
Id tend to call this an Imperial Stout.....
An exceptionally excellent one, at that.
Outstanding.

Very dark brown color with dark brown head that fads away at a moderate pace without lacing. The nose shows immense intensity of dark chocolate, tobacco leaves, roasted malt, molasses, peat, smoke, wood and dark fruit. Amazing depth. The body is not as full as I excepted with lots of tar, peat, dark chocolate, smoke, dark fruit, raisins, molasses. Modestly sweet. The honey balance out the flavors. Very intense, but for 10% the alcohol is well hidden in the mouth until you get to the finish and it has a very warming sensation that just lasts and lasts. Moderately aggressive hop bitterness in the end with lots of dark chocolate and roasted malt and a touch of honey. A true masterpiece that I would only fault for lacking the body I want, but otherwise a world class imperial stout. I need to cellar some of these.

I am rating again 30 minutes into the beer. The beer has more body as it warms, but also becomes more sweet, on the verge of too sweet. Also, I notice more port characters. I wont change my rating, but interesting to see how things change.
Dark brown/black colour, brown foam. Very complex aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee with hints of honey and light smokiness. Very well balanced. Malty and hoppy.

Bottle bought from the stags head, Sheffield. Black ale with tall foamy dark tan head. Liquorice, chocolate and dark fruits on the nose. Taste is sweet and bitter, plenty of liquorice and nutty honey. Alcohol warms the throat after swallowing. Mouthfeel is oily but not syrupy. Carbonation slightly over, but Ill forgive it that! Excellent.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 last rated about 18m ago, and I like it even more now. Gloriously dark and opaque, with a lasting off-white head. Full body, creamy but lively in the mouth. Wonderfully complex, with several layers of caramel, toffee and toasted malts, an underlying nuttiness, red fruits, smooth honey and a touch of spice. Really good.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2014 Bottle from cotteridge wines. Shared with s_hartshorne. Black beer with large mocha head that reduces to a head around the rim. Aroma of cocoa, praline, liquorice and dark fruit. Taste is liquorice, nuts, chocolate, sweet honey and dark fruits. The alcohol comes through as a slight warmth. Medium to full bodied with light carbonation and oily. Wow this could be the greatest beer I have ever had. I loved it. A tasting side by side of the rochefort 8 may be needed. I aint sharing the next bracia I buy.

text: Bottle shared thanks to sarky northerner. Black colour no head. Aroma is dark vinous fruits chocolate molasses honey malts. Taste has same features including liquorice good biter finish. Nice body smooth mouthfeel. Very complex this in taste and aroma really great stuff.
Fy tusan, det här var en kraftfull sak, smaken var komplex med toner av druva, choklad, sherry och vanilj. Kroppen är fånigt stabil och balansen fulländad. Slutsats; riktigt god sak!
From a 50 cl bottle at the beach in Avon NC. Pours black with tan head. Sweet honey nose. Flavors of tobacco, licorice and honey. Smooth finish.

.5l bottle @ Haltiatar 
Pours pitch black with low tan head. Aroma is plums, alcohol, coffee, brown sugar, malts, caramel. Flavor is alcohol, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, roasted malts, hops. Swell!

0,5l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, dark fruits and alcohol. Flavor is roasted malts, some dark fruits and loads of hops. Nice palate but slightly too hoppy. Could use some sweetness.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkelbrauens Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Früchten, Schokolade, malzig. Geschmack röstmalzig, dunkle reife Früchte, Schokolade, Kaffee, leicht alkoholisch.

Rating 1000. Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown body with a medium sized tan head. Aroma has honey and sweet perfume with hints of springtime forest. Lovely. Very thick body. Taste has dark malts with something lightly sourish and vinous like white grapes that have just started to ferment. Later hints of honey, raw hazelnuts and some hops that Im not used to finding in dark beers. This is a bold and wonderfully complex dark beer with so much to explore.

Rated on 5-09-2011. This bottled beer has a medium sized semi-frothy, very fizzy, very bubbly light brown head that mostly diminishes, opaque dark brown body and no lacing. The aroma is black malt, licorice, chocolate, hops, sweet, honey, and some alcohol. The taste is sweet, rich, malt, hops, chocolate, licorice, and spice. The mouthfeel is very tingly and this beer is medium bodied. This is a sipping beer with a very rich flavor. It is somewhat of a complex beer but very worth trying and a beer I would enjoy drinking again and again.

500 ml. bottle. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma of fruit, chocolate, malt, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruit, chocolate, honey, coffee, licorice, and a touch of smoke. Excellent, want more.

Swietne tradycyjne brytyjskie ciemne ale. Z brazowawa piana, czarnym nieprzezroczystym kolorem, W smaku ciemna czekolada, kakao na mleku nieco wanilli i miod. Zapach jakby capucino z orzechami laskowymi. Niebywale wrazenia. alkohol ukryty, niewyczuwalny, a przeciez jest w poteznej dawce. Wspaniale zbalansowane. Cos pomiedzy imperial stoutem, a mik stoutem. Takie mialem wrazenia. To najlepsze piwo od Thornbridge jakie kosztowalem. Polecam
Svart med högt högt brunt skum. Kraftig och kryddig smak, rätt bra balans i smaken.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG.Pours opaque black with a brown head, aroma is roasted, peat, vanilla, meat, spices, chocolate, nuts, flavor of chocolate, nuts, brandy, alcohol, bitterness, medium to full bodied.

Sammetslen Ale med brända toner och kaffearom, känner lite lakrits som smyger i bakgrunden. Ljusbrun skumkrona som försvann ganska snabbt.
